alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 9:19PM EDT until July 18 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Central Ohio, Fayette OH. In Southwest Ohio, Clinton and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Greene. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 919 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Sabina, Staunton, Good Hope, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Port William, Melvin, Reesville, Bloomington, New Antioch, Lees Creek, Burtonville, Interstate 71 at US Route 68, Lumberton, Middleton Corner, Oakland, Cowan Lake State Park and Ogden.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
